results.title: Lighting on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Larry Boehlins, an experienced “gaffer” covers key points such as: sources of power, hook up, the use of filters on lights and cameras, polaroid filters, window diffusion, use of reflectors etc. The film introduces a variety of grip equipment.

results.title: Lighting for television
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Mavis Lock
results.brief_description: An introduction to the problems and possibilities of television lighting, including the techniques of three and four point lighting. The base lighting of a face is analysed by means of a miniature studio. The problems of contrast lighting and the translation of color into black and white are dealt with, and the need for the producer’s cooperation is stressed.

results.title: Lighted windows: the story of a senior scout troop
results.creator_credit: Girl Scouts of the USA, Carol Hale and William S Resnick
results.brief_description: How a group of Senior Girl Scouts re-opened schools for after hour activities. The Senior Scout Planning Board initiates a survey that reveals a lack of recreational facilities throughout the city. Facts and figures are placed before community leaders and eventually the entire city becomes interested in the situation and a referendum is held. Suggests that individuals develop their personalities through team work and responsibility.

results.title: Light: refraction
results.brief_description: Explains how and why light is refracted when it passes from one substance into another. Discusses Snell’s law for determining the index of refraction, and shows how the laws of refraction are applied to lenses. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Explains how and why light is refracted when it passes from one substance into another. Discusses Snell’s law for determining the index of refraction, and shows how the laws of refraction are applied to lenses. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Light: reflection
results.brief_description: Discusses the law of reflection and formation of images. Illustrates the different types of reflection, and demonstrates the formation of real and virtual images in the plane, convex, concave and parabolic morrors. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Light: lenses and optical instruments
results.brief_description: Explains how lenses function. Shows the similarity of the operation of a simple camera to that of a human eye. Demonstrates the effects of different lens curvatures and systems of lenses. Discusses the uses of lenses in eyeglasses and other optical instruments. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Explains how lenses function. Shows the similarity of the operation of a simple camera to that of a human eye. results.title: Light years
results.creator_credit: Lexicon Films, Kathryn Millard and Patricia L'Huede
results.brief_description: Light years layers photographs, landscapes and stories to construct a sharply focused portrait of photographer Olive Cotton and the images and philosophies that have shaped her life and work. As one of Australia’s most accomplished photographers with a portfolio spanning sixty years, Olive and her story offer a rich insight into Australian life.

results.title: Light waves and their uses
results.brief_description: This elementary explanation of light deals with the following points: the principles of reflection with plane, concave, and convex mirrors; refraction in connection with lenses, with particular reference to the human eye; the principles and applications of interference; polar screens; the electro-magnetic spectrum; the quantum theory.
results.description: This elementary explanation of light deals with the following points: the principles of reflection with plane, concave, and convex mirrors; refraction in connection with lenses, with particular reference to the human eye; the principles and applications of interference; polar screens; the electro-magnetic spectrum; the quantum theory.
description_for_label: This elementary explanation of light deals with the following points: the principles of reflection with plane, concave, and convex mirrors; refraction in connection with lenses, with particular reference to the human eye; the principles and applications of interference; polar screens; the electro-magnetic spectrum; the quantum theory.

results.title: Light the empty places
results.creator_credit: Crawford-Senior Film Productions and Andrew Swanson
results.brief_description: A retired school teacher recounts his schooling, teacher training and teaching experiences in various schools with re-enacted sequences. This is followed by a survey of contemporary school facilities and specialised education services in Victoria. Features the Horsham High School Choir. Celebrates a centenary of State education in Victoria 1873-1973.

results.title: Light the deep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Defence scientists, using special laser technology, have developed a sophisticated device which will benefit the hydrographers of the world. It is used by the Royal Australian Navy, responsible for the production of all Australian navigational charts.
